CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, page 2, reads: "The 'Bathroom'? - What is considered the bathroom in most houses is nothing more than a putrid-smelling, broken-down commode in a dank basement hole for the Parrish family. The house, which was condemned on June 2, as unfit for human habitation, does not have any hot water and there is no bath tub. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Interior of destroyed bathroom with broken toilet, wood walls, floral carpet, and debris, including one item that reads "Kay's" on left
